titleStmt.title: B. D. Lacy et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4458

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thos. E. Bramblete
Gov of Kentucky
your petitioners represent that Ephraim Gooden of Bath County was by a Judgement of the Bath Circuit Court renderd at the Term 18 fined sixty dollars for the offense of Keeping a Tippling House

Your Petitioners represent that Mr Gooden is a man in indigent circumstances Has not been since the fine any way engaged in selling Spirituous liquors That In these time. of trouble It is very dificult to meet even current expenses in a County infested with bands of Gurillas

We therefore ask your Excellency to remit said fine
Dec 12th 1863

B D Lacy
Newton Moreland
Thomas D Crow
James F Shouse
William A Vise
Edward Burnas
W T Garret
Edgar Boone
Theophilus Hundit
Jno Miller
John J. Swetnam
Reuben Rogers
Jas Rogers
Dudley, Messick

Prayer of Pet
Rejected
Tho E Bramlette
